results.title: The Effect of Simvastatin on Gut Microbiota and Lipid Metabolism in Hyperlipidemic Rats Induced by a High-Fat Diet
results.text_hl: The objective of this study was to investigate the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (SIM) on @<m>DISEASE_Lipid_Metabolism_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D052439 @@@lipid metabolism disorders@@@ and gut microbiota in high-@CHEMICAL_Fats @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005223 @@@fat@@@ diet-induced hyperlipidemic @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhang Q, Fan X, Ye R, Hu Y, Zheng T, Shi R, Cheng W, Lv X, Chen L, Liang P. The Effect of Simvastatin on Gut Microbiota and Lipid Metabolism in Hyperlipidemic Rats Induced by a High-Fat Diet Front Pharmacol. 2020;11():522. PMID: 32410994
citations.BibTeX: @article{32410994, title={The Effect of Simvastatin on Gut Microbiota and Lipid Metabolism in Hyperlipidemic Rats Induced by a High-Fat Diet}, author={Zhang Q and Fan X and Ye R and Hu Y and Zheng T and Shi R and Cheng W and Lv X and Chen L and Liang P}, journal={Front Pharmacol}, volume={11}, pages={522}}

results.title: Improvement for high fat diet-induced hepatic injuries and oxidative stress by flavonoid-enriched extract from Nelumbo nucifera leaf.
results.text_hl: Interestingly, @CHEMICAL_Flavonoids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005419 @@@flavonoid@@@-enriched N. nucifera leaf extract supplement effectively ameliorated the high fat diet-induced @<m>DISEASE_Lipid_Metabolism_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D052439 @@@lipid metabolic disorders@@@ as significantly as @CHEMICAL_Silymarin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012838 @@@silymarin@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ did.

citations.NLM: Lin MC, Kao SH, Chung PJ, Chan KC, Yang MY, Wang CJ. Improvement for high fat diet-induced hepatic injuries and oxidative stress by flavonoid-enriched extract from Nelumbo nucifera leaf. J Agric Food Chem. 2009 Jul 8;57(13):5925-32. PMID: 19499892
citations.BibTeX: @article{19499892, title={Improvement for high fat diet-induced hepatic injuries and oxidative stress by flavonoid-enriched extract from Nelumbo nucifera leaf.}, author={Lin MC and Kao SH and Chung PJ and Chan KC and Yang MY and Wang CJ}, journal={J Agric Food Chem}, volume={57}, number={13}, pages={5925-32}}

results.title: PDGFRA, HSD17B4 and HMGB2 are potential therapeutic targets in polycystic ovarian syndrome and breast cancer
results.text_hl: Drugs or chemicals that contribute to correcting the @<m>DISEASE_Lipid_Metabolism_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D052439 @@@disorder of lipid metabolism@@@ were detected to restore the abnormal expression of the three genes in @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@, such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Bezafibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001629 @@@bezafibrate@@@, @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ et al, which provide further choices for managing @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@.

citations.NLM: Xu H, Han Y, Lou J, Zhang H, Zhao Y, Győrffy B, Li R. PDGFRA, HSD17B4 and HMGB2 are potential therapeutic targets in polycystic ovarian syndrome and breast cancer Oncotarget. 2017 Sep 19;8(41):69520-69526. PMID: 29050221
citations.BibTeX: @article{29050221, title={PDGFRA, HSD17B4 and HMGB2 are potential therapeutic targets in polycystic ovarian syndrome and breast cancer}, author={Xu H and Han Y and Lou J and Zhang H and Zhao Y and Győrffy B and Li R}, journal={Oncotarget}, volume={8}, number={41}, pages={69520-69526}}
